intro: Calamus sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flower calamus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arales. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender rhizomes and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of small, clustered spikes of greenish-white flowers. Calamus sessiliflorus is often found in wetlands and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, humid conditions.
